intro: Draba alshehbazii, commonly known as the Alshehbaz's whitlowgrass, is a small, flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Middle East. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with characteristic cruciform flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. It produces tiny white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. Draba alshehbazii is often found in alpine meadows and is known for its resilience in cold, high-altitude climates.
